poem:
Title: "In Opioid's Shadow"

The numbers fall, they say, a minor feat,
in halls of printed sorrow's summer heat.
A glimmer dances, hopeful in our sight,
yet still eclipsed by fentanyl's fierce might.
Ghostly visitors across America's bright stage,
build their castles of sand and synthetic rage.
But in the ebb, a silent whisper grows,
A Morse of hope, in a sea of unending woes.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "More than 100,000 people in the US died of drug overdoses in 2023 An estimated 107,543 people died of drug overdoses in the US in 2023, a shocking figure that obscures a glimmer of hope – this is the first annual decline in drug overdose deaths since 2018. The grim toll represents Americans’ struggle with powerful synthetic drugs, in particular the synthetic opioid fentanyl, known to be up to 100 times stronger than morphine. More". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
